Class item

java.lang.Object
db.item
public class item extends Object
Represents an item with an ID, type, associated menu items, and supply list. Includes database interaction to retrieve item type and supply information.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    item()
    Default constructor initializing item with an empty menu items list and ID of 0.
    item(int id, Item_t type, ArrayList<Menu_Items> menuItems, ArrayList<Integer> supply)
    Constructor to initialize an item with its ID, type, associated menu items, and supply.

  • Constructor Details

    • item

      public item()
      Default constructor initializing item with an empty menu items list and ID of 0.

    • item

      public item(int id, Item_t type, ArrayList<Menu_Items> menuItems, ArrayList<Integer> supply)
      Constructor to initialize an item with its ID, type, associated menu items, and supply.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the item.
      type - The type of the item (Item_t object).
      menuItems - The list of associated menu items.
      supply - The supply list (inventory IDs) for the item.

  • Method Details

    • getType

      public Item_t getType()
      Getter for the item type.
      Returns:
      The type of the item as an Item_t object.

    • setType

      public void setType(String name)
      Sets the item type based on the provided name. This method interacts with the database to retrieve the item type details and its associated supply.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the item type to set.

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Getter for the item ID.
      Returns:
      The ID of the item as an integer.

    • getTotal

      public double getTotal()
      Getter for the total cost of the item.
      Returns:
      The total cost of the item as a double.

    • getMenu_Items

      public ArrayList<Menu_Items> getMenu_Items()
      Getter for the list of associated menu items.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Menu_Items associated with the item.

    • getSupply

      public ArrayList<Integer> getSupply()
      Getter for the supply list of the item.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of integers representing the supply inventory IDs.

    • removeItem

      public void removeItem(int index)
      Removes a menu item from the list at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the menu item to be removed.

    • addItem

      public void addItem(Menu_Items mi)
      Adds a menu item to the list and updates the total price if it's a premium item.
      Parameters:
      mi - The Menu_Items object to be added.

    • getItemPrice

      public float getItemPrice()
      TODO: Implement this method to return the correct item price.
      Returns:
      A placeholder float value (currently set to 1).
